channel.title: Daily Newsletter
channel.description: Daily curated headlines from around the world.

item.title: U.S. and Israel Strike Iranian Nuclear Sites
item.description: The U.S. and Israel launched coordinated attacks on Iran’s Fordow nuclear facility, using bunker-buster bombs and cruise missiles. The UN warns of a “spiral of chaos” as Iran vows retaliation.
item.guid: U.S. and Israel Strike Iranian Nuclear Sites

item.title: Iran Vows Response as Israel Hits Tehran
item.description: Israel expanded its strikes to include six Iranian airports and parts of Tehran, including Evin Prison. Iran’s foreign minister condemned the attacks as sabotage of ongoing diplomacy.
item.guid: Iran Vows Response as Israel Hits Tehran

item.title: UN Chief Condemns Escalation in Middle East
item.description: UN Secretary-General António Guterres called the U.S. bombing of Iranian nuclear sites a “perilous turn” and urged all parties to de-escalate immediately.
item.guid: UN Chief Condemns Escalation in Middle East

item.title: Russia Launches Deadly Airstrikes on Kyiv
item.description: A major Russian drone and missile attack killed at least 10 people in Kyiv, striking residential areas and a hospital. It’s the second such attack in a week.
item.guid: Russia Launches Deadly Airstrikes on Kyiv

item.title: Global Airlines Suspend Flights Over Middle East
item.description: Major airlines have halted or rerouted flights due to escalating conflict between Israel and Iran. The aviation industry is bracing for prolonged disruption.
item.guid: Global Airlines Suspend Flights Over Middle East

item.title: Iranian Foreign Minister Meets Putin in Moscow
item.description: Iran’s Abbas Araghchi met with Russian President Vladimir Putin to discuss the crisis. Russia has called for restraint and warned against further escalation.
item.guid: Iranian Foreign Minister Meets Putin in Moscow

item.title: Trump Defends Strikes, Hints at Regime Change
item.description: President Trump defended the strikes as a “spectacular success” and hinted at regime change in Iran, despite intelligence assessments that Iran was not building nuclear weapons.
item.guid: Trump Defends Strikes, Hints at Regime Change

item.title: U.S. Congress Divided Over Iran Strikes
item.description: Trump ordered the strikes without congressional approval, briefing only Republican lawmakers. Democrats have condemned the move as unconstitutional.
item.guid: U.S. Congress Divided Over Iran Strikes

item.title: Oil Prices Surge, Then Stabilize
item.description: Oil prices spiked following the strikes but stabilized after OPEC+ reassured markets of supply continuity. Analysts warn of volatility if the Strait of Hormuz is threatened.
item.guid: Oil Prices Surge, Then Stabilize

item.title: UN Security Council Holds Emergency Session
item.description: The UN Security Council convened an emergency meeting to address the Middle East crisis. Several nations called for immediate ceasefire and diplomatic talks.
item.guid: UN Security Council Holds Emergency Session

item.title: EU Ministers Meet Amid Iran Crisis
item.description: European foreign ministers gathered in Brussels to discuss the Iran-Israel conflict. The bloc is divided on whether to impose sanctions or push for diplomacy.
item.guid: EU Ministers Meet Amid Iran Crisis

item.title: France Heightens Security After Iran Strikes
item.description: France has increased security at embassies and key infrastructure. President Macron called for a unified EU response.
item.guid: France Heightens Security After Iran Strikes

item.title: Germany Accelerates Renewable Energy Push
item.description: Germany announced a fast-track plan to expand wind and solar energy in response to energy instability. The move is part of a broader EU strategy to reduce reliance on Middle Eastern oil.
item.guid: Germany Accelerates Renewable Energy Push

item.title: UK Scientists Join Global Climate Monitoring Network
item.description: British researchers are contributing to a new international initiative to track climate change using satellite and oceanic data.
item.guid: UK Scientists Join Global Climate Monitoring Network

item.title: Scandinavia Launches Joint AI Ethics Framework
item.description: Norway, Sweden, and Denmark introduced a shared framework for ethical AI development, emphasizing transparency and human oversight.
item.guid: Scandinavia Launches Joint AI Ethics Framework

item.title: Vera Rubin Observatory in Jeopardy Before Launch
item.description: Funding and logistical issues threaten the launch of the Vera Rubin Observatory, a major astronomical project expected to revolutionize dark matter research.
item.guid: Vera Rubin Observatory in Jeopardy Before Launch

item.title: Record-Breaking Black Hole Discovered
item.description: Scientists have identified a black hole with unprecedented mass and spin, challenging current astrophysical models.
item.guid: Record-Breaking Black Hole Discovered

item.title: First Images of the Sun’s South Pole Released
item.description: A European solar mission captured the first high-resolution images of the Sun’s south pole, offering new insights into solar wind and magnetic fields.
item.guid: First Images of the Sun’s South Pole Released

item.title: AI Reveals Milky Way’s Black Hole Faces Earth
item.description: A new AI model suggests the supermassive black hole at the center of our galaxy is oriented toward Earth. Scientists say there’s no danger, but it’s a significant discovery.
item.guid: AI Reveals Milky Way’s Black Hole Faces Earth

item.title: Lost World Discovered Beneath Antarctica
item.description: Geologists uncovered a submerged ancient landscape beneath Antarctica’s ice, possibly containing fossilized ecosystems.
item.guid: Lost World Discovered Beneath Antarctica
